poem:
**Reality in Freefall**

Pundits pivot, spin tales,  
reality bends, vanishes into  
the static between signals,  
Cooper steers through,  
unfazed by the circus roar.  
Trump toys with geography,  
draws new frontiers in sand,  
towering fairways and tables.  
The world waits, holds its collective  
breath, caught in the lull  
of an unbroken headline.

Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
